VENDOR NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT

This Non-Disclosure Agreement ("Agreement") is made as of _____________, 20__ ("Effective Date")

BETWEEN:

Advanced Manufacturing Corp.
123 Industrial Parkway
Detroit, MI 48201
("Company")

AND:

_________________________
_________________________
_________________________
("Vendor")

WHEREAS, Company and Vendor desire to explore a potential business relationship for the supply of manufacturing components and/or services;

WHEREAS, in connection with such exploration, the parties may disclose certain confidential and proprietary information to each other;

NOW, THEREFORE, the parties agree as follows:

1. CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION
For purposes of this Agreement, "Confidential Information" means:
• Manufacturing processes, techniques, and methodologies
• Product specifications, drawings, and blueprints  
• Quality control procedures and standards
• Supplier lists and pricing information
• Production schedules and capacity data
• Cost structures and pricing models
• Tooling and equipment specifications
• Any information marked as confidential or proprietary

2. OBLIGATIONS
2.1 Each party agrees to:
   a) Hold the other party's Confidential Information in strict confidence
   b) Not disclose such Confidential Information to any third parties
   c) Use the Confidential Information solely to evaluate the potential business relationship
   d) Protect the Confidential Information using reasonable security measures
   e) Limit access to employees with a legitimate need to know

2.2 Vendor specifically agrees not to:
   a) Reverse engineer any Company products or processes
   b) Use Company's Confidential Information to compete with Company
   c) Disclose pricing information to Company's competitors

3. EXCEPTIONS
The obligations above shall not apply to information that:
   a) Was publicly known at the time of disclosure
   b) Becomes publicly known through no fault of the receiving party
   c) Was already known to the receiving party
   d) Is independently developed without use of Confidential Information
   e) Must be disclosed by law (with prompt notice to the disclosing party)

4. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
4.1 All Confidential Information remains the property of the disclosing party
4.2 No license or rights are granted except to evaluate the potential relationship
4.3 Any improvements or modifications to Company's designs remain Company's property

5. TERM AND TERMINATION
5.1 This Agreement shall remain in effect for two (2) years from the Effective Date
5.2 Confidentiality obligations survive termination for three (3) years
5.3 Either party may terminate with 30 days written notice

6. RETURN OF MATERIALS
Upon termination or request, each party shall:
   a) Return all tangible Confidential Information
   b) Destroy all copies and notes
   c) Certify in writing the completion of such return/destruction

7. REMEDIES
The parties acknowledge that breach may cause irreparable harm and that the non-breaching party shall be entitled to seek injunctive relief in addition to other remedies.

8. GENERAL PROVISIONS
8.1 This Agreement shall be governed by Michigan law
8.2 This Agreement may not be assigned without written consent
8.3 This constitutes the entire agreement between the parties
8.4 Any modifications must be in writing and signed by both parties

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the Effective Date.

ADVANCED MANUFACTURING CORP.         VENDOR

_________________________           _________________________
Signature                           Signature

_________________________           _________________________
Print Name                          Print Name

_________________________           _________________________
Title                              Title

_________________________           _________________________
